entry.title: SAP B1 10.0 FP2105 DI API ProductionOrderType always 'S'
entry.content:
private void AddProcessToSAP(ProductionOrderDTO process, SAPbobsCOM.Company company)
{
SAPbobsCOM.Recordset recordSet = (SAPbobsCOM.Recordset)company.GetBusinessObject(SAPbobsCOM.BoObjectTypes.BoRecordset);
recordSet.DoQuery($"SELECT TOP 1 DocEntry FROM OWOR WHERE Comments like '%{process.UserKey}%'");
if (recordSet.EoF) 
{
SAPbobsCOM.ProductionOrders productionOrder = (SAPbobsCOM.ProductionOrders)company.GetBusinessObject(SAPbobsCOM.BoObjectTypes.oProductionOrders);

SAPbobsCOM.Items item = (SAPbobsCOM.Items)company.GetBusinessObject(SAPbobsCOM.BoObjectTypes.oItems);
if (item.GetByKey(process.Material))
{
DateTime dtStartDate;
DateTime dtDeadLine;
productionOrder.ProductionOrderType = SAPbobsCOM.BoProductionOrderTypeEnum.bopotStandard;
productionOrder.ItemNo = process.Material;
productionOrder.PlannedQuantity = process.PlannedQuantity;
if (DateTime.TryParse(process.StartDate, out dtStartDate) == true)
{
productionOrder.PostingDate = dtStartDate;
}

if (DateTime.TryParse(process.Deadline, out dtDeadLine) == true)
{
productionOrder.DueDate = dtDeadLine;
}

productionOrder.ProductionOrderStatus = SAPbobsCOM.BoProductionOrderStatusEnum.boposPlanned;
productionOrder.Remarks = process.UserKey + " " + process.Remarks;
if (productionOrder.Add() != 0)
{
Console.WriteLine($"Error adding productionOrder: {company.GetLastErrorDescription()}");
}

}
}
else
{
DateTime dtDeadLine;
string docEntry = recordSet.Fields.Item("DocEntry").Value.ToString();

SAPbobsCOM.ProductionOrders productionOrder =
(SAPbobsCOM.ProductionOrders)company.GetBusinessObject(SAPbobsCOM.BoObjectTypes.oProductionOrders);

if (productionOrder.GetByKey(int.Parse(docEntry))) 
{
bool bChanged = false;
if (DateTime.TryParse(process.Deadline, out dtDeadLine) == true)
{
if (productionOrder.DueDate != dtDeadLine)
{
bChanged = true;
productionOrder.DueDate = dtDeadLine;
}
}

switch (process.Status)
{
case "PLANNED":
if (productionOrder.ProductionOrderStatus != SAPbobsCOM.BoProductionOrderStatusEnum.boposPlanned)
{
bChanged = true;
productionOrder.ProductionOrderStatus = SAPbobsCOM.BoProductionOrderStatusEnum.boposPlanned;
}
break;
case "RELEASED":
if (productionOrder.ProductionOrderStatus != SAPbobsCOM.BoProductionOrderStatusEnum.boposReleased)
{
bChanged = true;
productionOrder.ProductionOrderStatus = SAPbobsCOM.BoProductionOrderStatusEnum.boposReleased;
}
break;
case "FINISHED":
if (productionOrder.ProductionOrderStatus != SAPbobsCOM.BoProductionOrderStatusEnum.boposClosed)
{
bChanged = true;
productionOrder.ProductionOrderStatus = SAPbobsCOM.BoProductionOrderStatusEnum.boposClosed;
}
break;
case "CANCELLED":
if (productionOrder.ProductionOrderStatus != SAPbobsCOM.BoProductionOrderStatusEnum.boposCancelled)
{
bChanged = true;
productionOrder.ProductionOrderStatus = SAPbobsCOM.BoProductionOrderStatusEnum.boposCancelled;
}
break;
default:
break;
}

if (productionOrder.Remarks != process.UserKey + " " + process.Remarks)
{
bChanged = true;
productionOrder.Remarks = process.UserKey + " " + process.Remarks;
}

if (bChanged == true)
{
if (productionOrder.Update() != 0)
{
Console.WriteLine($"Error adding productionOrder: {company.GetLastErrorDescription()}");
}
}
}

}
}

DI API version 10.0 FP2105

Hy,

The created ProductionOrder's Type is always 'S' (bopotSpecial) but I set it as bopotStandard so it should be 'P' and the GetByKey() can't give back 'S' Type productionOrders.
Has it been fix in later versions, if yes which one?

Thanks

entry.title: Is Purchasing Group Field Locked in PRs Created from Maintenance Orders Due to Standard SAP Behavior
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community,

We recently encountered a situation in our development system where we attempted to edit a Purchase Requisition (PR) that was generated from a maintenance order. Despite having full access, we were unable to change the Purchasing Group and PR Header description field.

Based on our analysis, we believe this restriction is due to standard SAP behavior. Specifically, PRs created from maintenance orders inherit certain fields ‚Äî including the purchasing group and PR Header description ‚Äî directly from the order. These inherited fields appear to be locked for editing to ensure consistency between the maintenance order and the PR.

We‚Äôd like to confirm if this understanding is correct.

  • Is the purchasing group and PR Header description field intentionally locked in such cases?
  • Is there any standard configuration or enhancement that allows flexibility in editing this field?

Any insights or experiences from the community would be greatly appreciated!

Thanks in advance,
Sai Mungi

entry.title: SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition: We Want Your Feedback! - Commenting Feature Available
entry.content:
At SAP, we‚Äôre always looking for new ways to ensure our documentation truly helps you get the most out of your solutions. Today, we‚Äôre excited to announce that we‚Äôre piloting a commenting feature on SAP Help Portal, designed to encourage more direct dialogue between SAP, our customers, and our partners.

What‚Äôs Changing

Selected documents of the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition product assistance now have a commenting section, where you can ask questions, share your experience, or suggest improvements right next to the content that matters most to you.

Where Can You Comment?

Commenting is currently part of a limited rollout and available only for these documents:

  • Identity and Access Management
  • Data Migration
  • Master Data
  • APIs for Master Data Maintenance

Please note: This feature is only available in the English version of these documents.

How to Participate?

  1. Sign in to SAP Help Portal with your S-user or SAP Universal ID.
  2. Navigate to the documents listed above.
  3. Give feedback and leave your thoughts, questions, or tips directly in the commenting section.

Why Your Feedback Matters

Your real-world insights and experience help us keep our documentation practical and relevant. Whether you spot something unclear or want to suggest an improvement, every comment supports a better SAP community.

Let‚Äôs Shape SAP Documentation Together!

We‚Äôre listening and ready to engage with your feedback. Try out the new commenting feature today, share your thoughts, and help us shape the future of SAP product assistance.

To learn more about how the feedback process works on SAP Help Portal, refer to Giving Documentation Feedback on SAP Help Portal!

However, the Deactivate icon is greyed out. Initially for first catalog, i was able to deactivate excess apps. But i could not remove the additional apps for other three catalogs.

 

1st Catalog:

Other Catalogs :

But i cannot proceed with this as user will have access for both CO11N (Order confirmation) & CO13 (Order Cancellation) at a time. But the catalog doesn't support IAM apps.

Is there a possibility to restrict certain apps  for users in a single catalog or is there a option to hide the apps in the fiori launch space ( User should not be able to see additional apps) ?

Thanks in advance !

Regards,

Pranay Teja K.

entry.title: Re: Prevent Earliest Start Date from Going Past Today in...
entry.content: Your understanding is neither correct nor incorrect, as it depends on the process that the project manager and/or the company wants to adopt. This definition is made in the configuration, where you determine whether past dates can be used or not, and even how many days in the past can be allowed (in case past dates are desired). This setting depends on the Plant and the Order Type.

entry.title: 'Select All Fields' option in Story Report
entry.content:
Currently, while creating a story report, there is no option to select ALL fields in the 'Add Dimensions' option for both the Rows & Columns sections. All the fields that we add from the Data Source need to be selected individually at the 'Add Dimensions' section, only then the respective field reflects in the report.

There should be an option as 'SELECT ALL FIELDS' in the top-most column at the field selection list in the 'Add Dimensions' section. This would help all the people who work on Story reports & enhance the user experience.

I have submitted an enhancement request for this functionality. Please cast your vote if you feel this would help the users.

https://influence.sap.com/sap/ino/#/idea/357089

 

Regards,

Anvesh

entry.title: Re: ODP Extractors from S/4 HANA Not Visible in Dataspher...
entry.content:
Hi @SreekanthSurampally 

Thank you for the reply.

We are considering using SAP Datasphere purely as a pass-through layer (i.e., without staging data) and thought that replication flows would be the most suitable option for transferring data from S/4HANA or ECC to Azure Data Lake.

However, in scenarios where BW Bridge is required (especially when the data extractors do not have primary keys), we‚Äôd like to know:

Can BW Bridge be used as a pass-through layer as well ‚Äî enabling data transfer from S/4HANA or ECC to Azure Data Lake without persisting or staging the data within Datasphere?

Would appreciate your inputs

entry.title: Re: Use of Settlement Material in SAP S/4HANA Condition Contract
entry.content:
Hi @Maurizio65 ,

SAP offers a standard solution for "Goods Related Taxation":
"You can consider sales rebate agreements as a service for the customer. Under this perspective, you apply the usual value added tax for services. Alternatively, you can regard subsequent sales rebates as normal revenue reductions. Then you must apply the tax valid for the sales of a material (goods-related taxation)."

"Goods Related Taxation" and the use of the settlement material are compatible. 

Further information can be found in:

  • Document "Condition Contract Management - Sales Rebate Processing - Delivered Standard Configuration" from 2535889 - CCM - Description of delivered configuration - SAP for Me
  • Document "Sales Rebate Variations of the General Process" from 2564353 - Condition Contract Management: Product Overview Documents - SAP for Me

entry.title: Re: Controlling User Access to Projects Across Cost Cente...
entry.content:
In SAP PS, the Access Control List (ACL) is a feature that allows fine-grained authorization assignment for individual PS objects, including projects, work breakdown structures (WBS), networks, activities, and activity elements.

Take a look on Access Control List.

entry.title: Re: ABAP test cockpit (ATC) recommendations for governance of clean core ABAP development
entry.content:
We're on-premise and we use ATC checks during release of transport request. We want to use ATC checks for security vulnerables as well. At least on-premise, developers can simply pass ATC errors by adding pseudo comments to their security vulnerables. In my opinion, it absolutely makes no sense to allow pragmas for such sensitive checks.

When we now enable ATC in cloud + CVA for our on-premise systems, will developers still be able to pass checks by adding pragmas?

entry.title: How to size and support the new Crystal Reports DSL Engine Service?
entry.content:
SAP Crystal Reports 2020 SP3 Patch 4 introduced UNX universe connectivity that previously required the now-deprecated Crystal Reports for Enterprise. Accordingly, SAP BusinessObjects BI 4.3 SP3 Patch 4 introduced a new service to the Adaptive Processing Server, theCrystal Reports DSL Engine Service. Normally, the System Configuration Wizard in the Central Management Console splits the single default APS into multiple APS depending on which deployment template (small, medium, large, or extra large) is chosen. An administrator can get some clues on which services can be combined, which ones cannot, and how large the Java heap size should be. Unfortunately, the System Configuration Wizard in both BI 4.3 SP3 Patch 4+ and BI 2025  ignore the Crystal Reports DSL Engine Service, leaving it orphaned in the default APS. I have opened a support incident because I believe this is a software defect that should be corrected.

Crystal Reports services in BI 4.3 SP3 Patch4+

Crystal Reports services in BI 2025

The following KB are useful but do not answer my question.

SAP KB 1694041 - How do you configure the Adaptive Processing Server (APS) for improved performance and scalability? [Video]

SAP KB 3371775 - Crystal Reports 2020 on relational UNX - usage tips and restrictions

SAP KB 3564134 - Error: 'Cannot Connect to Adaptive Processing Service', when creating a report based on a Universe (UNX) in Crystal Reports

In the meantime, I'm curious to hear from other SAP BusinessObjects administrators what they are doing with the new Crystal Reports DSL Engine Service. Please share your advice in the comments.

entry.title: Embed Crystal Reports in a distributable file
entry.content:
I have a project that was first developed about 12 years ago which creates an application that need to be distributed to customers so they can install it on their laptops. It was developed using Visual Studio C# and Installshield, but I need to update it. Installshield is now obsolete so I'm using Wix to create a distributable msi.

The application ses Crystal Reports to allow the user to print a copy of the configuration file he creates.  I therefore need to embed a Crystal Reports viewer in the distribution.  I have tried various ways of achieving this withot success.  My latest attempt is to embed a merge module:

The project is now built on Visual Studio 2022 64-bit and Wix V4.  The distributable version is intended for use only on 64-bit laptops.

I have included this in Folders.wsx:

    <Fragment>
        <StandardDirectory Id="ProgramFiles64Folder">
            <!-- Under Program Files, create YOURCOMPANY\MyApp -->
            <Directory Id="ManufacturerFolder" Name="YourCompany">
                <Directory Id="INSTALLFOLDER" Name="$(var.Manufacturer)\$(var.Name)" />
            </Directory>
        </StandardDirectory>
        <StandardDirectory Id="ProgramMenuFolder">
            <!-- This dictates the name of the folder that appears in the Start Menu.-->
            <Directory Id="ApplicationProgramsFolder" Name="$(var.Name)" />
        </StandardDirectory>
    </Fragment>

This is in both Folders.wsx and Components.wxs:

    <!-- ICE83 demands:
        ‚Ä¢ MsiPublishAssemblies in AdvertiseExecuteSequence -->
    <Fragment>
        <InstallExecuteSequence>
            <!-- remove any advertised assemblies from prior installs -->
            <MsiUnpublishAssemblies Sequence="1501" />
            <!-- register new CLR/Win32 assemblies -->
            <MsiPublishAssemblies   Sequence="1502" />
        </InstallExecuteSequence>

        <AdvertiseExecuteSequence>
            <!-- register CLR/Win32 assemblies when advertising the MSI -->
            <MsiPublishAssemblies   Sequence="1502" />
        </AdvertiseExecuteSequence>
    </Fragment>

This is in Components.wsx:

    <Fragment>
        <DirectoryRef Id="INSTALLFOLDER">
            <Merge
              Id="CRMerge64"
              SourceFile=".\res\CRforVS64_mergemodules\CRRuntime64_13_0_38.msm"
              DiskId="1"
              Language="1033">
            </Merge>
        </DirectoryRef>
    </Fragment>

And this in Package.wxs:

        <Feature Id="Main"
                 Title="DUCX"
                 AllowAbsent="no"
                 ConfigurableDirectory="INSTALLFOLDER"
                 AllowAdvertise="no"
                 Description="The core elements that must be installed">
            <ComponentGroupRef Id="Components" />
            <MergeRef Id="CRMerge64" />
        </Feature>

You will see that it uses the 64-bit version of CRRuntime. However when I compile it I get numerous errors, including:

  • ICE03: Table: Font Column: File_ Missing specifications in _Validation Table (or Old Database)

  • ICE83: The MsiPublishAssemblies action MUST be present in AdvtExecuteSequence table.

and multiple errors like this:

  • ICE80: This 64BitComponent win64_x64.3A9D2E22.089E.41EE.8696.6BE8C981E0DD uses 32BitDirectory win64_x64.3A9D2E22.089E.41EE.8696.6BE8C981E0DD

I can't find any explanation for the ICE03 error.

  • The ICE83 error should be fixed by the first fragment above, but it obviously isn't.

  • There are about 20 ICE80 errors, which imply that some components of CRRuntime64_13_0_38.msm use 32-bit code, but it is supposed to use only 64-bit code.

There are also multiple warnings:

  • The Directory table contains a row with primary key(s) 'ProgramMenuFolder' which cannot be merged from the merge module '.\res\CRforVS64_mergemodules\CRRuntime64_13_0_38.msm'. This is likely due to collision of rows with the same primary key(s) (but other different values in other columns) between the database and the merge module.
  • ICE03: String overflow (greater than length permitted in column); Table: Registry, Column: Registry, Key(s): product.crystalreportsruntime64.module.langpackproperty_4.0_core_64.Registry1
  • ICE51: Font 'Code39AzaleaNarrow1.ttf.4A374CE0.8940.4C87.88CE.BACA5530C9DD' is a TTC\TTF\OTF font, but also has a title.

Any ideas what I'm doing wrong?  Is there a better way?

There are no errors if I comment out the MergeRef line, so it is responsible for all of them.

entry.title: What's New for SAP Business Network Suppliers: 2508 Release Highlights
entry.content:
In a recent webinar, we explored the latest updates from the SAP Business Network's August release.

Key highlights include significant enhancements to the Customer Relationship UI, such as Linked Child Accounts, aiming to improve clarity and usability.

We also discussed relocating key settings updates to the trading relationship request (TRR) emails, along with more details on these emails.

A noteworthy update addresses crucial changes in supplier account management. The improvements around account email domains and the introduction of temporary accounts emphasize better control of new user registrations, streamlining the process while maintaining account integrity.

Last but not least, interesting questions were brought up during the Q&A session, especially about temporary accounts and buyer permissions.

In all in all, these updates aim to enhance the overall user experience and efficiency of the SAP Business Network, making it easier for suppliers to navigate and manage their relationships effectively.  

So don't miss out ‚Äì watch the on-demand replay now for more information (also in Spanish and Portuguese)!

entry.title: How to delete Local ($TMP) objects from PRD.
entry.content:
During a recent ECC-to-S4 build, many Local objects were somehow migrated to our PRD environment. They should not exist there and I need to delete them.

I saw a post suggesting the use of program SEO_REMOVE_FROM_TADIR, but that program appears to only affect types CLAS and INTF.

Since transports are not assigned to $TMP objects, I can't use a transport landscape to delete them via the DEV-QAS-PRD route.

Any suggestions?

Thanks, Leo

entry.title: MQC formula
entry.content:
Dear All,

When opening a process order, the quantity of component A 13000XXX Plasma is adjusted according to the available batch in stock. In this example, we will assume that the available quantity is 5000 ML

According to this value of component A, component B 13000YYY Solution should be calculated as double that of component A, resulting in a value of 10000 ML instead 700.000 ML.

Is it possible to use this formula with MQC? How can I create this formula?

entry.title: Re: JCo Parameters
entry.content:
Actually the number of server (receiving) connection should be suitable to the resources the server can provide. Imagine the request processing uses CPU only. So the number of the server connections could be the number of CPU maybe 1 or 2 more. If the request processing goes to remote instances and the server is just waiting the most time, go ahead and set 10 x #CPU.

Keep in mind the overloading of the server resources will end with memory and performance issues on the server. 
It could be helpful to increase the heap size of the process using JCo not only the number of connections. And again avoid overload.

Hi, can you try the following?

from gen_ai_hub.proxy.langchain.init_models import init_embedding_model
from Parameters import * #define the connection to your aicore

os.environ["AICORE_CLIENT_ID"] = AICORE_CLIENT_ID

os.environ["AICORE_BASE_URL"] = AICORE_BASE_URL

embeddings

 

If this is now working, try please 

pip install "generative-ai-hub-sdk[all]"

entry.title: Re: Can we accept pronunciation of SAP as 'sap' rather than S.A.P ?
entry.content:
Hearing "sap" has made my brain hurt since the first day I have heard it, instead of S.A.P.  Part of that reason is that the word in German and English has a negative meaning; the other, is working with SAP a lot they always use S.A.P. anything else just seems wrong.   

Google has a great answer.  

People who want to demonstrate their knowledge about the company call SAP "S-A-P," not "sap," because it's an initialism (pronounced as individual letters) rather than an acronym (pronounced as a word), and calling it "sap" is considered incorrect and can even be offensive in Germany where the company is based, as the word "sap" can mean "fool" or "pig". 
 
Why it's pronounced "S-A-P"
  • Initialism vs. Acronym: 
    SAP is an initialism, an abbreviation formed from the initial letters of other words that are read out as individual letters (like FBI or CIA), not as a single word. 
     
  • Company Disagreement: 
    The company itself, and even some official sources, state that it should be pronounced as "S," "A," and "P". 
     
  • German Slang: 
    In German, the word "sap" (pronounced the same way as the English word) can be a slang term for someone foolish or easily taken advantage of, or can even be used to mean "pig". 
     
Who says "S-A-P"?
  • Experienced Professionals: 
    Consultants, developers, and other professionals who work directly with the software often call it "S-A-P" to show their familiarity with the system and avoid making a mistake. 
     
  • SAP Employees and Partners: 
    As a German company, they are particularly keen on the correct pronunciation, and their partners and employees are often trained to say "S-A-P". 
     
In summary, calling it "sap" instead of "S-A-P" can be seen as a sign of inexperience or can cause an unintended offense in certain contexts.

entry.title: Re: Onboarding 2.0 - Modify Task Due Date
entry.content:
Hello Melissa,

I'm Anderson from SAP Support, how are you doing?

You can define a custom due date which can be applied to all new hire tasks. These tasks include Personal Data Collection, Additional Data Collection, New Hire Data Review, Document Flows, and Onboarding Rehire Verification. The Onboarding Dashboard (New) displays the corresponding task due date for various new hire tasks based on the configured value.

If you want to modify the new hire's task due date to a day before the new hire's start date, you can configure the task due date using the Number of Days Before Start Date by when Assigned Task must be Completed option in the Manage Data page of the Admin Center.

Please, take a look at our guide for further insight: https://help.sap.com/docs/successfactors-onboarding/implementing-onboarding/configuring-due-date-for-new-hire-task-completion

Hope this helps

Anderson

entry.title: Re: USING WBS BOM IN REQUISITION
entry.content:
Hello @yinka_o 

Thank you for your question.

I suggest you consult Maintain Bill of Material, Project Control - Enterprise Projects & Project Control - Enterprise Projects links for more details.

To summarise, yes, you can use WBS BOM to model your rate-based construction mixes and automatically generate purchase requisitions for all components without manually entering each item in the WBS demand screen.

Adhering to the SAP recommended way to handle rate analysis in construction projects ensures you avoid manual entry of each component by:

  • First, using the Manage Bills of Material to create a BOM for the concrete mix following the exemplary numbers you provided.
  • Thereafter, assign the BOM to the relevant WBS element in you project structure.
  • When you run the material planning for the WBS, the system will explode the BOM and generate demands for each of the component.
  • Then the demands are converted into purchase requisitions through the MRP, which you can then monitor in Manage Purchase Requisitions.

I hope this provides the desired insight.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Introducing a New Badge Progression Set Just for Bloggers
entry.content:
In August, we launched three new badge progression sets that rewarded members for providing solutions to questions, earning kudos, and giving kudos. Now, after a brief badge hiatus, we‚Äôre back with a brand-new progression set exclusively for bloggers.

The previous sets built upon existing badges that have been available since we launched the new platform last year. To be specific: Before we rolled out those sets last month, members could earn a badge for their first kudo received, their first kudo given, and their first answer accepted as a solution. So we‚Äôve long encouraged ‚Äì and commended ‚Äì those activities. With this new progression set, however, we are returning to recognizing members solely for their blogging.

On our previous SAP Community platform, members could have earned five badges for publishing blog posts: Blogger, Avid Blogger, Skillful Blogger, Master Blogger, and Grand Master Blogger. You may even stumble across these retired badges when you click ‚ÄúView all badges‚Äù on the content page of a long-time member. For example:

We haven‚Äôt had the equivalent of those blog badges on this platform, but that will change as of Wednesday, September 24 ‚Äì the day when we bring back a progression set just for blogging.

This blogging set, like the other sets made available in August, will contain five badges in total. We‚Äôll award the first badge to members who published one blog post, the second to those who published two blog posts, the third to those who published five blog posts, the fourth to those who published ten blog posts, and the final badge to those who published thirty.

We plan to award the badges retroactively, so if you‚Äôre already an active blogger, you can expect one or more badges tomorrow. If you‚Äôd like to know exactly how many you‚Äôll get (if any), you should check your ‚ÄúMy content‚Äù page to confirm how many blog posts you‚Äôve published. To do that, log in, then select ‚ÄúMy content.‚Äù

Once you‚Äôre on your content page, you‚Äôll notice a gray box at the top. Please ignore it, as the numbers there aren‚Äôt related to the blogging badges. (The ‚ÄúPosts‚Äù number in this gray box does indeed include your blog posts, but it also includes your discussions, comments, and other content types that you‚Äôve posted to the community. So it‚Äôs not the figure used for the blogging set.) Instead, scroll down to the ‚ÄúPrivate Stats‚Äù section and look for ‚ÄúBlog Articles Posted.‚Äù That‚Äôs the number which will determine how many blogging badges you receive. Here‚Äôs an example.

In this case, this member will earn all five badges tomorrow, as his 150 posts exceed all the necessary thresholds associated with this set.

We‚Äôll assign the badges one at a time (from lowest to highest) over the course of a few hours tomorrow, and members will get notifications for each one received ‚Äì so if you‚Äôre like the member in the example above, don‚Äôt be surprised when five notifications come your way.

If you have your notifications turned off (but you‚Äôd still like to monitor your progress tomorrow), then refresh your ‚ÄúMy content‚Äù page periodically throughout the day. Each time you get a badge, you‚Äôll see it appear in the upper right, as well as on the page accessible from the ‚ÄúView all badges‚Äù link.

If you‚Äôre still waiting for your badges to show up by Thursday, September 25, please log out of SAP Community and log back in. Your badge(s) should be visible then.

Blogging is one of the most important and time-consuming activities available to members, and we‚Äôre happy to recognize our dedicated bloggers once again. If you‚Äôd like to get involved with blogging, start by taking our community tutorial and familiarize yourself with our moderation policy for blogging. We want you to earn those blogging badges ‚Äì and it might be tempting to try to push through thirty posts quickly to max out the set ‚Äì but you should only submit one post at a time, per article 1 of our rules of engagement. Pace yourself, do things right, and you‚Äôll find success as a blogger (with the badges to show for it).  

By sharing their knowledge (or perhaps a little about themselves), community bloggers deliver content that educates and engages our members. This set is just a small way of thanking them. And more thanks are coming. We‚Äôll introduce additional badges soon, so even if you aren‚Äôt a blogger, you may find yourself earning other badges for additional content type contributions in the very near future. Stay active in all areas throughout the community and see what happens. And remember: Even the simple act of leaving a kudo on content that you enjoy can bring you one step closer to a badge. Any positive action in the community, no matter how big or small, makes a huge difference, and these badges demonstrate our appreciation for your quality contributions.

entry.title: Incident with FM SD_VBPA_READ_WITH_VBELN in S4HANA
entry.content:
Good afternoon,

We have an incident with the FM SD_VBPA_READ_WITH_VBELN.

We use it in a Client Transaction that creates a delivery and in S4/HANA does not work. That is because of this form, VBPA_BP_AND_ADDRTYPE_GET.

 

These are the details of the code:

S4HANA (lines 95-107)

SELECT * FROM VBPA INTO TABLE LB_VBPAVB
                     WHERE VBELN = I_VBELN
                     ORDER BY PRIMARY KEY.
  IF SY-SUBRC EQ 0.
    PERFORM VBPA_BP_AND_ADDRTYPE_GET
        TABLES LB_VBPAVB.
    IF VBPA_LINES EQ 0.
      VBPA_LINES = SY-DBCNT.
      BF_VBPAVB[] = LB_VBPAVB[].
    ELSE.
      VBPA_LINES = VBPA_LINES + SY-DBCNT.
      INSERT LINES OF LB_VBPAVB INTO BF_VBPAVB INDEX BF_TABIX.
    ENDIF.

 

ECC (lines 95-105)

SELECT * FROM VBPA INTO TABLE LB_VBPAVB
                     WHERE VBELN = I_VBELN
                     ORDER BY PRIMARY KEY.
  IF SY-SUBRC EQ 0.
    IF VBPA_LINES EQ 0.
      VBPA_LINES = SY-DBCNT.
      BF_VBPAVB[] = LB_VBPAVB[].
    ELSE.
      VBPA_LINES = VBPA_LINES + SY-DBCNT.
      INSERT LINES OF LB_VBPAVB INTO BF_VBPAVB INDEX BF_TABIX.
    ENDIF.

 

This form appears in the new system and reset the value of SY-DBCNT. Then, the delivery is not create.

 

The only way to force it to work is having an item in KNVK with the code of the partner. We do not create this codes as a Contact Partner and if we would start to do it we need to change all of our processes involve.

Do you know how to handle this? Have anyone this problem?

Thanks in advance

Kind regards

entry.title: Planning & Analytics (P&A) is an essential part of SAP Business Data Cloud (SAP BDC)
entry.content:
In today‚Äôs fast-paced business world, the ability to effectively steer and lead an organisation is crucial for achieving strategic goals and maintaining a competitive edge. The capacity to fully harness and derive value from organisational data is key success criteria. However, many companies struggle with data problems (fragmented information, outdated systems, and the challenge of preparing data for emerging technologies like AI).

Our blog series will provide valuable insights for decision-makers seeking to harness SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC) to enhance operational efficiency, optimise resource allocation, and achieve long-term objectives. By featuring detailed planning & analytics topics, the series will illustrate the transformative impact of SAP BDC in addressing the operational complexities of today‚Äôs business environment. The second blog post will summarise key arguments why Planning & Analytics (P&A) is an integral part of SAP BDC.

Picture 1: SAP BDC Intelligent Application - Working CapitalThere are several blog posts in the series that will cover advantages of SAP BDC in the context of business steering, so please stay tuned for the upcoming blogs:

  1. The value of SAP BDC in the context of business steering
  2. Planning & Analytics is an essential part of SAP BDC (THIS BLOG POST)
  3. Key Planning & Analytics components of SAP BDC
  4. Is AI going to ‚Äúretire‚Äù a dashboard?
  5. Simulations, a game changer in today‚Äôs volatile world
  6. Move BPC and BW-IP into SAP BDC
  7. Real-time steering with LIVE planning
  8. PaPM use cases
  9. Self ‚Äì service analytics and real time business steering
  10. Business steering powered by AI agents
  11. Leverage data products in the context of planning & forecasting
  12. Introducing AI/ML capabilities by SAP Databricks

SAP BDC is equipped with powerful data management, planning & analytics (P&A), and innovative AI capabilities to tackle all these challenges and P&A is an essential part of SAP BDC. It provides transformative insights, seamless integration, AI augmentation, and enhanced data quality. These capabilities are crucial for effective business decision-making and strategic planning. Here are the key reasons why P&A is vital within SAP BDC:

Picture 2: SAP BDC high level architecture & flows in the context of business steering

  • Transformative Insights: P&A uncovers hidden insights using advanced analytics and planning applications across all lines of business. This capability allows organisations to make informed decisions based on comprehensive data analysis.
  • Seamless Integration: It combines SAP and third-party data to unify diverse data sources, enabling comprehensive analysis and a holistic view of business operations. This integration is crucial for maintaining data consistency and accuracy across the enterprise.
  • AI Augmentation: The integration of business AI, such as SAP‚Äôs AI copilot Joule, enhances decision-making by providing augmented insights and predictive capabilities. This helps businesses anticipate future trends and make proactive decisions.
  • Enhanced Data Quality: P&A automatically connects data across the business, ensuring accuracy and accelerating time to insight. This is essential for maintaining high data quality and reliability in business processes.
  • Agile Modelling and Predictive Analysis: Planning & Analytics supports agile data modelling aligned with analytics. It uses AI and machine learning to facilitate predictive analysis and simulation, enabling businesses to adapt quickly to changing conditions and optimise their strategies.
  • End-to-End Visibility: Planning & Analytics offers a 360-degree view of critical business processes with fully-managed, curated data products. This comprehensive visibility and control over operations provide businesses with a clear understanding of their performance.

Picture 3: SAP BDC - AI-powered Live-Planning & Analytics in SAP BDC

Planning & Analytics is an essential part of SAP BDC, empowering organisations with the tools and insights needed to drive strategic initiatives, improve efficiency, and enhance decision-making across the enterprise.

The usage of Planning & Analytics (P&A) is therefore closely connected to the performance of an organisation and creation of business value through several key mechanisms that enhance decision-making, efficiency, and strategic alignment. Here‚Äôs how P&A impacts organisational performance:

  • Real-Time Insights: The ability to access real-time data and insights allows organisations to respond quickly to market changes and operational challenges. This agility is crucial for maintaining competitive advantage and optimising performance, especially in turbulent times like today.
  • Strategic Alignment: By aligning financial and operational plans with strategic objectives, P&A ensures that all parts of the organisation are working towards common goals. This alignment is critical for achieving long-term success and improving overall performance.
  • Data-Driven Decision Making: P&A tools provide a single source of truth for data, reducing the need for manual reconciliation and enabling more accurate and timely decision-making. This shift from manual processes to automated data integration enhances efficiency and reduces errors.
  • Improved Forecasting Accuracy: P&A tools, such as SAP Analytics Cloud, enable organisations to conduct predictive forecasting and scenario planning. This improves the accuracy of financial and operational forecasts, providing a forward-looking view of performance. This allows leaders to react promptly, leading to better resource allocation, strategic planning, and improved performance.
  • Enhanced Collaboration: By integrating planning processes across different departments, such as HR and finance, P&A fosters collaboration and alignment within the organisation. This integration helps create a unified approach to achieving business goals and improves communication across teams.
  • Increased Efficiency: Automation of planning processes reduces the time and effort required for data collection and analysis, allowing employees to focus on higher-value tasks such as strategic analysis and decision-making.

In summary, Planning & Analytics enhances organisational performance by improving forecasting accuracy, fostering collaboration, providing real-time insights, enabling data-driven forward looking decision-making, ensuring strategic alignment, and increasing efficiency. These benefits collectively contribute to a more agile, informed, and strategically aligned organisation.

Do you want to embark on a journey? Please reach out to your SAP representative and register for your SAP BDC Discovery Workshop!

In our next blog post, @Nektarios_Vasileiou33  will take you behind the scenes to unbox the key Planning & Analytics components of SAP BDC ‚Äî solutions that help businesses streamline planning, enhance decision-making, and foster cross-department collaboration. By exploring SAP BDC capabilities, you‚Äôll see how they drive more effective enterprise planning and analysis. Get ready for insights that unlock sharper strategies and smarter decisions. Stay tuned!

entry.title: Re: How to enable caching for SAP OData V2?
entry.content:
Hello,

I am trying to do the same thing right now. My understanding is:

  • Change data provider class of your service in /IWBEP/REG_SERVICE to /UI2/CL_GW_DP_CACHE
  • Update your MPC_EXT by adding a "define" REDEFINITION with the following code:
" In MPC_EXT of your service
METHOD define.
    model->extend_model( iv_model_name = /ui2/cl_gw_mp_cache=>gc_cache_model_name ).
    super->define( ).
ENDMETHOD.
  • Use /UI2/CACHE Transaction. Service name is your services technical name, but data provider class should be your own DPC_EXT!
  • Regenerate Metadata

In your code snippet, it cannot work, because you wrote /UI2/CL_GW_DP_CACHE in /UI2/CACHE. The purpose of /UI2/CACHE is to let the /UI2/CL_GW_DP_CACHE data provider know where to look for your data provider class, not the other way around!

You can also implement a "cache support" class. I think it should implement /UI2/IF_CACHE_SUPPORT, if you want to influence how the caching occurs and /UI2/IF_CACHE_SUPPORT_2 if you want to influence invalidation. I might update if i figure out more.

entry.title: Re: Implementation of a taxable entity across system boun...

entry.title: Program RMFPLA01 revokes the PO approval After upgrading to S/4 FPS03 2023
entry.content:
After upgrading to S/4 FPS03 2023 which was released on February 26, 2025.  on top of S/4 HANA Cloud private. , the release strategy of POs is revoked when the PO, which is released via the workflow, is opened in ME22 and the delivery date is changed. 

The issue is that the program RMFPLA01 for invoicing plan is calling ME22 in background. Consequently,  the PO approval is revoked as soon as the program RMFPLA01 runs.

Neither custom code nor implicit enhancements are used.

entry.title: SAP Enable Now Manager's Automatic User Deactivation feature does not reactivate a returning user
entry.content:
Hello all, we are using the  SAP Enable Now SEN Manager Cloud > Administration > User Management > Automatic User Deactivation feature. Single Sign On is configured, and SAP Companion is configured to show content from the SEN Manager. Two questions:

  1. After a Learner is Automatically Deactivated for non-use of the SEN Manager, shouldn't it Automatically Reactivate them through Single Sign On if they try to touch the SEN Manager again? (either through a link to content stored on the Manager, or by accessing the SAP Companion which is linked to the Manager.) Ours doesn't - if they're using Companion, it displays a Windows login prompt for them to log into the SEN Manager manually. If they try to access the SEN Manager URL directly like a Learner would, it displays the SEN Manager logon screen and a red message "Your account was locked." If we turn on the Active checkbox for them and have them refresh the browser, then they can click the "Alternative: Login with your Single Sign On account"  link, and it works. But nothing will re-authenticate the user automatically - the Manager Administrator has to turn on the Active checkbox for the user. That's a problem because we have hundreds of returning users. 
  2. In the Manager settings, the Automatic User Deactivation > Email Address For Reports field only allows one email address. You cannot add multiple addresses like you can for the Notifications and Email > Email Settings > Email Address for Learner Feedback field. We've tried commas, semicolons, with and without spaces, but the Automatic User Deactivation > Email Address For Reports field won't allow more than one address. Is that by design, or is it a bug?

Thanks in advance for your help!

entry.title: Re: How to display custom MIGO fields in Stock ‚Äì Multiple...
entry.content:
Hi @Tharma ,

We had a similar requirement recently. We were able to achieve this by:

  • Redefining the standard OData service used by the Stock ‚Äì Multiple Materials Fiori app and including our custom fields there, and

  • Using the ‚ÄúCustom Fields‚Äù (CF) app in Fiori to add the required fields and make them available in reporting.

This approach allowed our custom fields (added in Post Goods Movement) to become visible and reportable in the Fiori application. You might consider the same setup to meet your requirement.

Best regards,
Sudheer Chunduru

entry.title: Re: SAP Inside Track Philadelphia

entry.title: Re: How to delete Local ($TMP) objects from PRD.
entry.content:
Hi Leo,

Unfortunately $TMP objects are local and not transportable, so you can‚Äôt remove them from PRD via a normal DEV ‚Üí QAS ‚Üí PRD transport route. In most cases, the only way is to:

  • Open the PRD client temporarily for changes (using SCC4) under a controlled change window,

  • Delete the $TMP objects directly (using SE80, SE38, or SE24 depending on the object type),

  • Then close the client back to ‚Äúno changes‚Äù after the cleanup.

There isn‚Äôt a standard SAP program that mass-deletes all local objects across object types. SEO_REMOVE_FROM_TADIR works only for CLAS/INTF but not for other objects.

Best practice:
Document all objects first (SE03 ‚Üí ‚ÄúDisplay Objects by Package‚Äù for $TMP) and get approvals. Do the cleanup in a downtime or low-risk window, because you‚Äôre making direct changes to PRD.

This is the safest and most direct approach available.

Best regards,
Sudheer Chunduru
